term_description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study
term_error_message: Only letters and numbers allowed. No spaces or special characters.

term_description: Official name of the study or project. Project title should be fewer than 30 words, such as a title of a grant proposal or a publication.
term_example: Study of single cells in the human body

term_description: A detailed description of the project which includes research goals and experimental approach. Project description should be fewer than 300 words, such as an abstract from a grant application or publication.
term_example: This project explores the intricate details of single cells in the human body, focusing on their structure, function, and behaviour. By studying individual cells, it aims to uncover how they contribute to overall health, disease progression, and human biology. This research can provide deeper insights into cellular processes, paving the way for advancements in medical treatments and personalised medicine.

term_description: The workflow or protocol followed during the study.
The sorting or visualisation technology used.
The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation
The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive
term_error_message: Only letters and numbers allowed. No spaces or special characters.

term_description: Variable aspects of an experiment design that can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI)
term_error_message: Format: Text with no leading/trailing spaces, a space, then [Letters:Numbers].

term_description: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence.
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study
term_error_message: Only letters and numbers allowed. No spaces or special characters.

term_description: A 16-digit number that uniquely identify researchers.
term_error_message: Value must follow the format XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX.

term_description: A first name (or given name) is the personal name given to an individual conducting the study.
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: A last name (or surname) is the family name passed down from one generation to the next for the individual conducting the study.
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: A unique identifier used to send and receive electronic messages (emails) over the internet.
term_error_message: No consecutive dots or hyphens, must contain '@'.

term_description: An organisation or institution that this person is associated with.
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: A grant that directly or indirectly provides funding or sponsorship for the person to conduct the study.
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for the  study if refering to
term_error_message: Only letters and numbers allowed. No spaces or special characters.

term_description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the study.

term_description: Report the host's taxonomic name and/or NCBI taxonomy ID
term_error_message: String must start with uppercase and contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: The full scientific name of the species studied.
term_error_message: String must start with uppercase and contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: An identifier of the strain of the organism, if applicable.
term_error_message: Value should match the format - either a two-part string with a language code and identifier in square brackets, or a positive integer.

term_description: The type of tissue sampled for the study.

The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008; Except: 2008-01; 2008 all are ISO8601 compliant
term_error_message: Expected format is YYYY-MM-DD, optionally followed by 'T' and HH:MM, with possible timezone information.

term_description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees, limited to 8 decimal points, and in WGS84 system
term_error_message: Value should be a number between -179 and 90, with up to 8 decimal places.

term_description: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). Reference: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling.
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling.
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier assigned to the sample in the study related to NCBI Taxonomy.
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ)
term_error_message: Expected format: label1: value1, label2: value2.

term_description: The vertical distance below local surface. For sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples
term_error_message: Number must be valid, optionally in scientific notation.

term_description: Elevation of the sampling site is its height above a fixed reference point, most commonly the mean sea level. Elevation is mainly used when referring to points on the earth's surface, while altitude is used for points above the surface, such as an aircraft in flight or a spacecraft in orbit
term_error_message: Number must be valid, optionally in scientific notation.

term_label: Amount or Size of Sample Collected
term_description: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected
term_error_message: Number must be valid, optionally in scientific notation.
String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating libraries
List of database(s) used for ORF annotation, along with version number and reference to website or publication
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling in degree celsius
term_error_message: Number must be valid, optionally in scientific notation.

term_description: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material
term_error_message: Value should match one of the following formats: PMID followed by digits, a DOI starting with 'doi:10.', or a valid URL starting with 'http' or 'https'.

term_description: Heights of objects such as airplanes, space shuttles, rockets, atmospheric balloons and heights of places such as atmospheric layers and clouds in metres (m). It is used to measure the height of an object which is above the earth's surface. In this context, the altitude measurement is the vertical distance between the earth's surface above sea level and the sampled position in the air
term_error_message: Number must be valid, optionally in scientific notation.

term_description: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field.
term_error_message: Only letters and numbers allowed. No spaces or special characters.

term_description: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly)
term_error_message: Input should match the format: one or two non-space, non-hyphen characters, or a sequence of characters with no spaces or hyphens, followed by a space, then a valid locale code (e.g., en:5). Avoid spaces or hyphens within the code.

term_description: To what is the entity pathogenic
The type of reproduction from the parent stock. Values for this field is specific to different taxa.
The device used to collect an environmental sample.
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: Description of relationship(s) between the subject organism and other organism(s) it is associated with.
Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report
term_error_message: Value should match one of the following formats: PMID followed by digits, a DOI starting with 'doi:10.', or a valid URL starting with 'http' or 'https'.

term_description: The phylogenetic marker(s) used to assign an organism name to the SAG or MAG
Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

Information about the genetic distinctness of the sequenced organism below the subspecies level, e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: List of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at https://www.disease-ontology.org, non-human host diseases are free text
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: The method employed for collecting the sample

term_example: Barcode information used in multiplexing protocols is provided in a separate file, which can be accessed at: https://example.com/barcode_data.csv.
term_error_message: String must contain at least one lowercase letter.

term_description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study
term_error_message: Only letters and numbers allowed. No spaces or special characters.

term_description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the library preparation protocol used during the sequencing.
term_error_message: Only letters and numbers allowed. No spaces or special characters.

term_description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.
term_error_message: Only letters and numbers allowed. No spaces or special characters.

term_description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this file
term_error_message: Only letters and numbers allowed. No spaces or special characters.

term_description: The name or accession of the file that contains read 1.
The name or accession of the file that contains read 2.
The name of the file that contains index 1.
The name of the file that contains index 2.
Result of a hash function calculated on the content of the read 1 file  to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).
Result of a hash function calculated on the content of the read 2 file  to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).
Result of a hash function calculated on the content of  the index 1 file  to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).
Result of a hash function calculated on the content of  the index 2 file  to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).

A file containing the known cell barcodes in the
dataset.
A filename or file name is a name used to uniquely identify a data file related to the study.
A file type is a name given to a specific kind of file. Common file types are fastq, gtf, fasta, bam, archive etc.
The name or accession of the file which quantifies the level of gene, transcript, or protein expression in a given biological sample or condition.
